title: How to Vanish a Coin Using Aluminium

steps.headline: Smooth out the aluminium.
steps.description: Make sure there aren't any lines or creases on it.

steps.headline: Place the coin on the aluminium on any side that you would like, front or back.
Trace the outline of the coin on the aluminium.
Put the aluminium on the edge and trim the extra foil with the toothpick.
Trace the outline, the images, the letters, and all the detail on the aluminum.
steps.description: Be extra careful if your audience is very precise and observant.

steps.headline: With the aluminium still on the quarter, fold the aluminum around the coin and on the edge smoothly.
steps.description: Do not fold any aluminum on the back of the quarter. If this step is not done incorrectly, it makes the trick less believable.

steps.headline: Take the real quarter out of the aluminium.
Perform the sleight of hand.
steps.description:
When performing this trick:
First, show the fake quarter to your audience within a fine distance. Then, place the rectangular piece on top of the fake quarter and snap your fingers. Lastly, crumple the piece of paper and the fake quarter to a small size, showing the audience how a quarter which was supposedly made of metal is now crumpled and folded.

steps.headline: Have fun with this magic trick!

text:
Smooth out the aluminium. Make sure there aren't any lines or creases on it. Place the coin on the aluminium on any side that you would like, front or back.  Trace the outline of the coin on the aluminium.  Put the aluminium on the edge and trim the extra foil with the toothpick. Be gentle while removing. Trace the outline, the images, the letters, and all the detail on the aluminum. Be extra careful if your audience is very precise and observant. With the aluminium still on the quarter, fold the aluminum around the coin and on the edge smoothly. Do not fold any aluminum on the back of the quarter. If this step is not done incorrectly, it makes the trick less believable. Take the real quarter out of the aluminium.  Perform the sleight of hand. When performing this trick:
First, show the fake quarter to your audience within a fine distance. Then, place the rectangular piece on top of the fake quarter and snap your fingers. Lastly, crumple the piece of paper and the fake quarter to a small size, showing the audience how a quarter which was supposedly made of metal is now crumpled and folded. Have fun with this magic trick!
